Uses of Class
edu.drexel.cs.jah473.distance.KDPoint

    • Uses of KDPoint in edu.drexel.cs.jah473.distance

      Methods in edu.drexel.cs.jah473.distance with parameters of type KDPoint 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double HaversineDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance between two latitude/longitude points using the Haversine distance formula.
      double SquaredEuclideanDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance between two points using the squared Euclidean distance formula.
      double ManhattanDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance between two points using the Manhattan distance formula.
      double EquirectangularDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Estimates the unitless distance between two latitude/longitude points using an equirectangular projection.
      double SquaredEquirectangularDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Estimates the squared unitless distance between two latitude/longitude points using an equirectangular projection.
      double ChebyshevDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance between two points using Chebyshev's distance formula.
      double DistanceFunction.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance between two points using the formula specific to the implementing class.
      double EuclideanDistance.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance between two points using the Euclidean distance formula.
      abstract double AbstractLatLonDist.distanceBetween(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2) 
      double AbstractLatLonDist.distanceBetweenKM(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance, in kilometers, between two latitude/longitude points.
      double AbstractLatLonDist.distanceBetweenMI(KDPoint point1, KDPoint point2)
      Calculates the distance, in miles, between two latitude/longitude points.
